data.title: The Cardiac & Vascular Institute
data.meta_description: Meet Dr. Arthur C. Lee! Lee holds board certifications in Intervential Cardiology, Nuclear Cardiology, Echocardiology, and Internal Medicine.
data.text:
Dr. Lee's Bio

Dr. Arthur Lee graduated Cum Laude with his Bachelors of Science from the University of Pennsylvania. He attended medical school and completed his Residency at Mount Sinai in New York City. He stayed in New York City where he completed his Fellowship at Beth Israel Medical Center.

Dr. Lee’s joined the Cardiac & Vascular Institute in 2005 holding board certifications in Interventional Cardiology, Nuclear Cardiology, Echocardiology and Internal Medicine. He is ASH certified making him one of TCAVI’s five Hypertension Specialists. His areas of clinical interests also include Interventional Cardiology, Peripheral Vascular Disease (both the arterial and venous systems), Critical Limb Ischemia and Orbital Atherectmony, Dr. Lee is TCAVI’s Director of Peripheral Vascular Services and a Diplomate of the American Board of Vascular Medicine.

In addition to his many publications and articles, Dr. Lee is highly engaged in TCAVI’s cardiovascular research efforts being the first in the world and the U.S. to enroll patients into groundbreaking clinical trials. Outside of the office, Dr. Lee enjoys reading, fishing and spending time with his family.
